attributes.action: Do more to tackle dog theft
attributes.additional_details: Britain’s dog owners and walkers are becoming increasingly afraid to walk their dogs on pavements, roads, footpaths and public parks. They cannot even safely let their dog in their own back garden unattended. There is clearly no deterrent to these thieves and it appears they are becoming more brazen and extreme in their tactics and attacks. Britain is supposed to be a civilised country, not one that people are becoming afraid to walk the public highways in daylight.
attributes.background: Create a plan to tackle the rise in dog theft from walkers and from back gardens and buildings. Make it more difficult for van loads of stolen dogs to be transported abroad.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand you'd like more to be done to tackle pet theft, but not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do, or you might like to sign some of these petitions:

Increase minimum and maximum sentences for pet theft
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563711

Make it illegal to sell dogs without a licence
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/571526

Make dog theft a specific criminal offence
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560216

Increase penalties for dog theft and illegal puppy farming
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574650
